intro: Cynoglossum mollissimum, commonly known as velvetleaf forget-me-not, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. Its foliage is often used in gardens for its ornamental value, and it is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar botanical features.
